definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: The human resources are available on the day shift only on weekdays.
sentences.chinese: 只有在工作日的白班纔有人力資源可用。

sentences.english: The performance test shall be carried out in daytime.
sentences.chinese: 驗收考覈均在白班內進行。

sentences.english: I'm on day shift this week.
The workers in this workshop do day and night shifts in weekly rotation.
sentences.chinese: 這個車間的工人上白班和上夜班每週輪換一次。

sentences.english: The day shift arrives [ arrive ] at eight o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 白班工人八點鐘來換班。

sentences.english: from tomorrow on I`m working the main shift.
sentences.chinese: 從明天開始我就上白班了。

definition: to change shifts/to work in turns
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
to hand over to the next workshift
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
